metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6791 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in soliduiserver/deviceserviceaction.cpp in KDEPlasma Workspace before 5.12.0. When a vfat thumbdrive that contains `` or$() in its volume label is plugged in and mounted through the devicenotifier, it's interpreted as a shell command, leading to a possibility ofarbitrary command execution. An example of an offending volume label is"$(touch b)" -- this will create a file called b in the home folder.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6791` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libkworkspace5-5 - 4:5.5.5.2-0ubuntu1.1
libplasma-geolocation-interface5 - 4:5.5.5.2-0ubuntu1.1
libtaskmanager5 - 4:5.5.5.2-0ubuntu1.1
libweather-ion7 - 4:5.5.5.2-0ubuntu1.1
plasma-workspace - 4:5.5.5.2-0ubuntu1.1
plasma-workspace-wayland - 4:5.5.5.2-0ubuntu1.1
sddm-theme-breeze - 4:5.5.5.2-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: plasma-workspace package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:5.5.5.2-0ubuntu1.1').
